Hello,

I am running a Heritrix 1.14 crawl on a 8-core Xeon machine with 16=
 GB RAM. My goal is to collect all domain names on the Internet possibly qu=
ickly and without doing anything else. What would be the best configuration=
 to approach this? 

My current config is: BroadScope, no frontier changes,=
 a single Extractor collecting every new domain name it sees to a MySQL DB,=
 running with 100 threads and a couple thousand directory style seed sites.=
 The problem I am running into is the following:

- first, stuff goes well =
and domains are found at a rate of 100+/second
- after about 30-40 minutes =
and about 50000 domains collected, the rate of new-found domains slows down=
 very much to below 1/second and stays there. the crawl also slows down fro=
m 100+/second to 10 or less per second. no scope or seed changes seem to af=
fect this. even if I take a completely new set of seeds, it only produces a=
 couple hundred new domains at best and then similarly dies off into nothin=
gness.
- this seems strange behavior given that there are 200mil+ domains a=
nd an entirely unrelated set of seeds (I've taken only .jp domains, for exa=
mple), should produce at least a similar set of total new domains found. it=
 doesn't, however. at the moment I'm stuck at why this is the case.

Any th=
oughts?

Thanks,
Sergey
